metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0556 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Improper access control in subsystem for BlueZ before version 5.54 mayallow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilegeand denial of service via adjacent access

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0556` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
bluez - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
bluez-cups - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
bluez-hcidump - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
bluez-obexd - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
bluez-tests - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
libbluetooth3 - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bluez package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.37-0ubuntu5.3').
